intro: Pfaffia paraguayensis var. laurifolia, commonly known as Paraguay guarana, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its lanceolate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, particularly the presence of stimulant compounds similar to those found in guarana. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both traditional medicine and modern pharmacological research.
